author: Danish Tom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020
review_content: This sweatshirt appears to be a fantastic value. The fit, style and quality are all elevated from a basic sweatshirt. I’ve worn it 10+ times and washed it all without any problems. The fabric is soft, pleasant to touch, and a little finer feeing than typical sweatshirt material. I am 6’0” 165 lbs and typically wear a medium if I want to be relaxed and comfortable. This medium fits that bill. I consider it just a bit loose for my preference at my current weight, but it still looks trim enough and should remain a comfortable fit with some winter weight (commonly flex to 185 in winter). I would consider this a medium weight fabric (though I could see how some would call it lightweight.) It’s fairly thin for sweatshirt material, but warm and cozy - not at all thick or heavy feeling. Should work broadly on cool spring and fall days as well as mild winter days or as a winter layer.2 little gripes: 1 - this color was called “light heather gray.” Other customer images and the model pictures seem to show that color, but my sweatshirt is much more medium gray/gunmetal. I wasn’t thrilled about it at first, but my “fashion experts” tell me it’s a better color than the lighter gray, so I’m good — but it seems there could be an inconsistency with this color. 2. I have a tiny quality control issue I’ve yet to report. There’s a metal cap on the drawstring, but only one end has it. It’s nice looking, but I’m not worried about having it or not... just need to find out if I can take the one cap off without damaging the plastic binding. Or if they could send a replacement cap I guess? Seems silly though - I just want to make the 2 ends match.Giving 5 stars because my concerns are minor compared to the quality and value. And I’m very happy with the swearshirt :)
